content:
In the wild west, a time of change
When open range seemed so strange
For ranchers, life was hard and tough
But barbed wire brought a welcome rough

No longer did their cattle stray
From open fields to towns away
No longer did they lose their herd
And their profits soared, undeterred

The fences kept the land secure
From predators, wild and impure
The crops grew strong, the cattle fat
And fortunes were made, just like that

But then a twist came, unforeseen
A darkness spread, a stifling sheen
For fences barred the way to roam
And freedom's call, no longer home

The cowboys lost their wild terrain
And with it, the freedom they gained
Their lives were now confined and small
No longer did they hear the call

The plains that once seemed infinite
Were now just lines, cold and definite
The fences marked the end of range
And the beginning of a prison strange

So now we stand, and look around
At the fences that we have found
And wonder at the cost we paid
For the security that we've made

For though we've gained much, it's true
We've lost a lot, and that's not new
And so we live, resigned and still
With fences that define our will.
